page.title: 19Lower Mill Lparish
page.content: {Lower Mill }was mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086.It was then a { {flour mill.}The old wood and metal wheel of the {undershot}type was last used in 1943 to produce {electricity {for the house.}The miller's house has disappeared and in its place is a sunken garden with a sundial.The old building was extended about 60 years ago and Lower Mill is now an attractive brick house in an estate of 27 acres.The main house and the lodge are both heated by a large wood and straw burning boiler which is kept going throughout the year.The {old {orchards and glasshouses}have been re- placed by lawns and a wide variety of trees brought from all over the world. Among these are a North American Indian bean tree and a number of less familiar species.
